Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Beatrice B
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days in April with my husband and two children at the Purple Home (Violet Apartment). We were very satisfied. The apartment is spacious, quiet, and confortable. It is equiped for cooking and there is a big fridge. There is a supermarket at 300 meters, we took our breakfasts and dinners at the appartment. It is very close to St Peter's place (5 minutes walk). To go to the Navonne place, 30 minutes walk are necessary, or it is possible to take the bus which stoppes very close from the apartment. We took the transfer by taxi from the airport, reserved by the owner, it costs 55 euros, which is much more convenient than the public transportations and not so much more expensive for 4 persons. I have already recommended this apartment to friends that want to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: krowena
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Purple Home in early March 2012 with my husband and my parents. We got the 2 rooms apartment on the ground floor, the apartment is nice, clean and comfortable. The location is excellent and it is just 5-8 mins walk to St Peter's. There's also a Carrefour supermarket just 3 mins away. We end up cooking in the apartment for our breakfast and dinner. It was a great happy relaxing experience. Wi-fi is available and the connection works fine. We had arranged a car pick up from the owner and it turns out to be cheaper than taking public transportation from or to the airport. So, I suggest if you have 4 ppl on the trip, order the car pick up and it is cheaper, faster and easier. Please let the owner knows that if you arrive early in the morning, or otherwise you will be standing at the door waiting for the owner to come. As it is not a hotel, there's no check in counter. The owner need to come from somewhere to open the gate the door for you. Overall, great happy stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, budget accommodation but wouldn't stay again!”
Reviews.Author: mariebell
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Purple Home, there were 3 in our party. The apartment location is excellent and just 5 minutes walk to St Peter's with all other sites within easy reach. The apartment (Plum) is very basic so don't expect too much in terms of luxury! The photographs do do it more justice than it deserves. There are many good deals around in Rome for accommodation, particularly in hotels so given the choice again, I would rather pay some more euros for some service and a little comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Anthurium apartment in Campo de Fiori - WONDERFUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: AlisonCP
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two married friends rented the Anthurium apartment in Campo de Fiori through The Purple House website we found on tripadvisor. It was a 2 bedroom-2 bathroom apartment with private entrance, a full kitchen, a living room with TV and wi-fi, and a washing machine. The apartment was so comfortable, clean, and so well located, we absolutely loved it! Alissandro was managing the property and checked us in when we arrived. He was also available for general travel advice, and even tried to get soccer tickets for us while we were there (non-residents weren't allowed that game). He was very helpful!!! The location was absolutely perfect, and right above an excellent restaurant called Pierluigi. Next time I'm in Rome this is where I'm staying! I'm recommending this to all my friends and family. LOVED IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Plum Condo”
Reviews.Author: audiogirl8
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here with another couple. The location is fantastic and can't be beat! Very close to Vatican City, lots of restaurants, etc. and just one block from the main bus line that takes you to the Forum, etc. Note that there is only 1 true bedroom, and the second "bedroom" is open to the kitchen and living area. The main bedroom can be a bit noisy as you hear people entering/leaving the building at all hours of the day, but it is set back far enough from the street that there is no other competing noise. I will say the bed was fairly uncomfortable, but after being exhausted with all the sight-seeing, it didn't interfere too much with sleep. We had a few minor problems (backed up drain in en suite shower, limited house hold essentials (i.e., toilet paper, sponge in kitchen, etc) but a call to the property managers and they responded promptly and fixed/provided needed supplies. Overall, I would recommend staying here as the location and price are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay for a couple”
Reviews.Author: OyvindRBK
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 4 nights at Purple home in Rome. For the two of us this was a perfect place to stay when we visited Rome. Better than an hotel, close to the Vatican, and buses very close to other areas of the town.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Lauren M
Reviews.Content: We are just finishing a 3 night stay at Purple Home. Great for the budget conscious, a much better alternative than hotels. Easy walking distance to the Vatican, and bus to all the sights only 50m away. The Colloseum at the other end of town if you're keen is less than an hour walk. The apartment is very comfortable with kitchen facilities, only down side no washing machine (however this seems to be the norm). Close to restaurants and small grocers. Would highly recommend the restaurant I San...Pietrini. Great communication with Alessandro and Valentina, also very accommodating with our late check out. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice appartment, great location, "cold" reception...”
Reviews.Author: ISR77
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Purple Home; The apartment is beautifully decorated and equipped; everything a family needs; the location is also very convenient...a walking distance from the Vatican & few Euros taxi to the center; The down side was the reception: we arrived (from the airport) with a car sent by the hotel, after arrival to the building, we had to wait more than 15 minutes in the cold and dark, with the building doors closed until we have decided to call Alessandro (from Purple Home) to come and "save us"; we would expect (the hotel´s) driver to announce our arrival for a much warmer reception.

Reviews.Title: “Purple Plum apartment Rome”
Reviews.Author: SallyJulietChrisMark
Reviews.Content: An extremely comfortable apartment, well placed with thoughtful and helpful owners who made our 4 night stay for four of us very pleasant indeed. Whilst parking is first come first served, we were able to safely park free for our stay as well right outside the door - although once parked we left the car where it was! The bus stops right outside so getting into the centre is easy, and the Vatican and nice restaurants are walking distance - the guide is a great help and Alessandro and Valentina will be adding to this with an excellent map. They are easily contactable for any help while you are there as well. WiFi is available and it is helpful to take a device so you can look at the internet. Provisions are available from the supermarket a few steps up the road. Booking is easy too, and the apartment does represent really good value. We would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “feels like home!”
Reviews.Author: marga v
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Purple Home Plum apartment (1 couple and 2 friends ) for 6 days.Everything was perfect.First of all the location was ideal, 50 meters from bus station there is bus No 64 which can take you to Roma termini passing through the city center with many stops.At the next block on the left ,there is big super market and from the other side there is an amazing bakery with tasting Italian breakfast and many other cafeterias.The Vatican is very close ,approximately 15 minutes light walking and about 20-25 minutes from Trastevere ,a MUST SEE location!!!(The best restaurant that we visited 3 times in our stay was DA GILDO highly recommended!!! As for the rooms we also see all the other apartments Violet and Blush and was exactly as shown in the site and the Violet was Perfect.Finally we want to thank the kind owners for being kind and friendly and very helpful!For close up ,Purple Home is our first choice for our next trip to Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for families”
Reviews.Author: Jorge Arturo M
Reviews.Content: We were 5 adults staying at the Plum apartment last december. We were very confortable and the apartment was very well equipped and clean. The location is perfect, 5 minute walk to the Vatican City on a very secure and quiet street and the bus stop is very close. All this for an excellent price! The only thing that needs improvement: the showers are small.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great value”
Reviews.Author: fqfernandes
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Purple Home for 3 nights with 2 more people and the place was perfect for us. Very good location, just 5 min walking from the vatican, the bus stop is also very close to the building and the bus 64 takes you to Roma termini passing through the city center. The apartment is spacious and beutifully decorated. Although the building is old, the apartment is completely refurbished.Alessandro is a great host and gives you valuable tips.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment--Could have been Better”
Reviews.Author: Kmari78
Reviews.Content: It was disappointing to read such great reviews about this place and have so many issues while staying in the Blush apartment. First, Valetina failed to give us the key to open up the building to get into the apartment. When we told Alessandro about this issue he indicated that he would come and give us the key but failed to do this throughout the weekend. So each time we came back from our excursions we had to ring the tenants of the building to get them to open up the building for us. Another disappointment was that the hot water did not last very long while taking a shower in the morning. The hot water would go in and out several times. For two people staying in the Blush apartment there was not enough hot water for both of us. Another annoying point was that there was no toilet paper in the apartment when we arrived. So we had to dash out and get some right away. For these reasons, I rated the service very poor. These are little kinks that made me contemplate whether I should have spent my money on staying in a hotel instead of at this place. The best part of this place was the location. It is located right next to the Vatican. The neighborhood was very quiet and I felt very safe. It is too bad that the little things ruined our stay in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Purple Homes - Violet Apartment”
Reviews.Author: SHARON W
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest places I've ever stayed in, so nice to have a whole apartment not just a hotel room....very clean, bright, airy and modern. Loved the little balcony and cool decor and the small bedroom is not as small as you might think! It's incredibly close to the centre of Rome - can be walked in about 25 minutes and is less than 10 minutes walk to the Vatican. There are some lovely restaurants close by and a good supermarket less than 5 minutes walk away. The owners are also very helpful, friendly and accommodating. Couldn't have asked for a warmer welcome - they took such good care of us - thank you Alessandro!! I would highly recommend the Violet apartment....it really made the holiday for us.

Reviews.Title: “I truly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Carolina G
Reviews.Content: Valentina's place is picture-perfect! Excellent location walking distance to Vatican just one block from a big supermarket in a very quiet and safe neighborhood. Super clean, tidy and well decorated. She also personally showed me her others 02 flats located in the same building and all of them are very charming. Valentina and her husband are friendly, communicative and helpful couple. Thanks again for keeping our bags and for the late check out. I certainly would return ;)

Reviews.Title: “Live like the Romans do at the Purple Home”
Reviews.Author: jimmyinthecity79
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Purple home in early October. The owners Alessandro and Valentina basically own a few apartments in the same building that have a nice neighborhood feel to the location. The apartments are IKEA modern and clean. Like our reviewers have stated, the location of the Purple Home is extremely close to the Vatican city and because it is Rome, easily walk-able to everything else. Because the location is on the other side of the river, that means everyday you will need to make your trek by foot either through the Vatican city, under the long bridge or over the big hill. OR you can take the 64 Bus and watch the Gypsies try to steal your soul...or your wallet. :) The 64 stop is right outside the apartment complex, however we only used the bus once during our trip. The apartments themselves have everything you would need while staying in Rome; a fridge, microwave, running water, air or heat, WiFi internet and a wine opener. If you want to skip staying at a hotel and have an authentic trip in Rome, stay the Purple Home. You can beat the value or the experience. Thank you Valetina and Alessandro, we had a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, spacious,clean and nice apartment”
Reviews.Author: Yeeming
Reviews.Content: We spent a few 4 nights in Rome and our stay in Purple Home was simply wonderful. We were greeted by Alessandro upon our arrival and they have made it so convenient for us to check in and ensuring that we were equipped with all the information to get around and back to the apartment. The apartment location is really great with only 10 mins walking distance to Vatican city and there is a bus stop directly opposite which takes you to right to the centre of town. The apartment was really clean with very nice setup of the room and kitchen. On top of that, the price is very reasonable for such sizes of apartment in Rome. It is definitely a great choice if you are travelling to Rome. Thank you Alessandro!

Reviews.Title: “Try It You Will Love It”
Reviews.Author: SobeWanderer
Reviews.Content: My partner and I and two other couples were in Rome for the first 2 days of a two and a half week trip to Italy and decided to try an apartment stay as it would be less expensive than 3 hotel rooms. Always having stayed in hotels when traveling I was a little reluctant about this new experience. We decided on 2 apartments at Purple Home based on the reviews both here and other sites. If my experience at Purple Home is representative of an apartment stay experience I won’t hesitate to do it again. From the beginning I had a good feeling, as the hosts, Valentina and Alessandro, were very responsive when I communicated with them prior to our arrival in Rome. Alessandro made arrangements in advance for a van airport pickup, which given that there were 6 of us was far more economical and convenient than taxies. The hosts, a young couple, greeted us upon our arrival at Purple Home and made sure to explain everything we needed to know about the 2 apartments that we were staying in (a 2 bedroom/ 2 bath and a 1 bedroom/1 bath). Purple Home is in a residential neighborhood very conveniently located to many of the important sights of Rome. Our apartments were fresh and contemporary, and most importantly clean and comfortable (we had the 2 ground floor apartments, so our views were not quite postcard worthy; this was not a problem for us). We felt very safe staying there, even when walking back late at night. There is a nice supermarket just down the street, and while we did not have the opportunity to try them, there are a number of restaurants and cafes within walking distance. Valentina and Alessandro were perfect hosts and always responsive when we had a problem or needed information. Shortly after our arrival at Purple Home I realized that my ipod was missing and suspected that it had fallen out in the back of the van when a bag fell over. Valentina called the driver and sure enough it was on the floor of the van. She made arrangements for the return and there it was in my room when I returned from sightseeing! Another time we were stuck for a place to eat and called Valentina for a recommendation. Even though I could hear the baby crying in the background, she took the time to discuss what we were looking for and came up with the perfect restaurant! We had a wonderful time on our visit to Rome and our stay at Purple Home certainly contributed to that experience!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful apartment in great location”
Reviews.Author: Mandy T
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Purple Home in September 2011. The apartment was spacious clean light and very modern. It is located in a great area extremely close to The Vatican. There is a supermarket across the road and a few restaurants within a 5-10 minute walk. We found it very easy to travel around Rome from the apartment, on foot and by bus. The owners were incredibly friendly and accommodating and also organised our airport transfers. We would recommend this apartment and hope to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: JosephineRapson
Reviews.Content: This appartment was absolutely perfect. I used to live in Rome and know it well. The place is ideally located, very clean, has all the useful amenities one could ask for. The owner is very helpful and nice, assisting us in getting a car to pick us up from the airport, making sure there was processo when we arrived, and also being on hand all weekend for advice on where to go and eat / party / be cultured. Book it! It's brilliant!!! (Also fabulous value)

Reviews.Title: “Re-discovering Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jebsen
Reviews.Content: I recently came back from a summer vacation in Italy, where Rome were the final destination. Having many travelling days a year I am well used to hotels and high standards. However, in the past I have had various experiences in Rome. This time around, my girlfriend and I chose to look for something less touristic and by luck a I came over Purple Homes. One phone call later with the host, Alesandro, I was convinced that this was what we wanted, which more than enough proved to be the case for what we were after. The apartment has everything you need and more. Not only do you feel like being home, Purple homes offers all the services and choices you get at up scale hotels. Only difference, genuine recommendations from true Romans. And hey, dont worry about not having a concierge, Alesandro takes care of that with his connections all around the city. Having been in Rome many many times, this time around I left with the feeling of having visited the city for the very first time. Many many thanks to Valentina and Alesandro for hosting us in this beautiful apartment, but also for their great service and advices. Will definitely come back. Grazie mille!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place run by fantastic people”
Reviews.Author: emn315
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked Purple Home for our 3 day trip to Rome. We had a bit of trouble finding the place, but we blame that on our GPS. It is in the middle of everything but surprisingly quiet at night. The three balconies allow for a lot of fresh air and the air conditioner in the living room works great. The local restaurant is delicious and the staff is great. Literally 10 minutes walk (at the very most) to the Vatican. Clean and spacious and perfect for our stay. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A stylish week-end in beautiful Rome”
Reviews.Author: Guillaume C
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 days with my girlfriend in one of the stylish appartment provided by Purple Home in the very center of Rome; nearly 300m from the Saint Peter and the Vatican. First, the location is perfect and central, and only a few moments from the oldest parts of the City. There are a bunch of buses around the corner which enable anyone to move easily around the city. Alessandro and Valentina take a lot a of pride in welcoming their guest in these very well decorated and stylish flats in the centre of Rome. The flats have been completely re furbished, they are brand new and very clean. They are also very well equiped with Wi-Fi Internet, flat screen TV (including all the international and movie channels) as well as a modern kitchen. Overall these are very nice, bright and fresh appartements in the centre of Rome - which is great given that most of the other flats/hotel rooms we have seen for that price range were old and unwelcoming. Alessandro and Valentina are a young and very welcoming couple. They are extremely friendly Romans and it was a real pleasure to meet them! They both know the city extremely well and speak English perfeclty. Alessandro knows all the best and non-touristee restaurants and bars where you will meet only Romans and little tourists. This is from my exprience one of the real plus of knowing someome in a city like Rome: to advise you places where Romans actually go. You will find better food and services for cheaper prices in a more characteristic place. Follow Alessandro's advices and you won't be dissapointed. Also, Purple Home offers additional and a complete set of services for its guests ranging from car services to a special chef to cook in the flat or they can organise massages in the flat which are very nice after a long day walking across the city. The website describes all this very well, just ask Purple House to arrange anything for you. Overall this is to me the best compromise to visit a city like Rome: stylish and modern appartments which are very well located and with the independancy of your own flat but with the services of an hotel - should you require and ask for them. Having travelled for many years around Italy and the world, getting some local advices/suggestions are priceless - this can really change your experience to make it unique and memorable - and Purple House does this very well! A Happy Purple Home guest.

Reviews.Title: “Purple Home a perfect deal!!”
Reviews.Author: HAndrei
Reviews.Content: I've been for the first time in Rome this summer, for 6 nights, with 2 friends, in Purple Home's Violet apartment, and I can't wait to go there again, it was an amazing trip! The flat was better than the photos, perfectly clean, excellent position, central to let you visit the city, but also silent to take a rest after the really tiring walking days, before going out at night. The main room was spacious and quiet, decorated with handmade design objects you can even buy. The living room also spacious with a wide sofa bed and a dining table, and the kitchen was well equipped to cook anything you like. We also found oil, salt, vinegar, tea, coffee, and some other ingredients we could avoid to buy. There is a big supermarket with less than a minute walk. However there are lots of refreshment points in the area, even though the best ones are in the historic centre, 5 minutes by bus, or 15 walking. The bus stops right next to the building and goes through the city centre (tickets must be bought at the bar behind the corner, not on the bus! we almost had a bad experience). Going towards the centre you can always find a seat, as Purple Home is at the first stop, while coming back home the bus is often very crowded during the day, but looking at the city doesn’t make the hot bothering you too much. Valentina and Alessandro, the managers of the apartments, were really helpful and friendly, they sent us a chauffeur to pick us at the airport, with an elegant car for a good price. What we appreciated most were their suggestions for restaurants, shops, clubs, and also museums. They have created a guide with the map of Rome, with all these places on it, very practical and easy to find, it was a real fun guide! I would definitely suggest this place to my friends, Purple Home deserved the maximum rate, hope to be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up for the apartment and the location!!!”
Reviews.Author: DeniseB54
Reviews.Content: This was a long awaited first time trip to Rome and we enjoyed every minute of it. This was in part due to the amazing location of the apartment and wonderful service. The apartment was very clean, comfortable and well equipped. we had first class service from the booking to departure. Also, they arranged driver services to and from the airport...completely hassle free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and nice people”
Reviews.Author: Fabrice187175
Reviews.Content: Nice and confortable flat very close to the Vatican

Reviews.Title: “Purple Home accommodations in Rome were convenient and service was excellent”
Reviews.Author: JMM2011e
Reviews.Content: We stayed at one of Purple Home's two bedroom apartments in mid-June 2011 for a week in Rome. The address is below for anyone checking the location. It is a 5-10 minute walk to the Vatican on a nice street with numerous restaurants and bars (for coffee, mostly). There is a laundromat on the street about halfway between the apartment and the Vatican, although, if you want anything pressed and not just dump in a plastic bag when your clothes come out of the dryer, you will pay extra for that. Name of apartment Purple1 Place of check-in: Apartment Address of check-in: Rampa delle mura aurelie 9 (this is the tiny side street and not the main street that is less than 50 feet away). The apartment was comfortable with two bedrooms and two full baths with stand-up showers only. Small kitchen with mini refrigerator and small stove-top. Could use an American style coffee maker if you want a regular cup of coffee in the morning (there is a "Bar" that serves coffee about 3 minutes down the street, but you will not be getting a regular sized cup of anything). Excellent secure front door with elaborate locking system if you are concerned about security (we weren't as the neighborhood seemed fine). Grocery store less than five minutes away. The exterior of the building and the immediate surroundings are not designed to impress but the interior was perfectly fine. Alessandro, our contact manager for Purple Home, met us at the apartment and let us in. He was very helpful well before we arrived with suggestions for restaurants, etc. We really liked him and he was excellent in providing a great level of service. No onsite management, but Alessandro was remodeling an apartment next door to ours and we saw him often. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, chic and convenient apartment”
Reviews.Author: Rachel A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this stylish apartment at the beginning of August for three nights. It accommodated myself and my partner, plus my step-son and mother very comfortably. It is very well-equipped, especially the kitchen, if you want to eat in. It is beautifully decorated and clearly well looked after and maintained. It is also extremely conveniently located, just 5-10 minutes walk from the Vatican and about 20 minutes from Piazza Navonna and there is also is a bus which stops just down the road. There is an excellent supermarket in walking distance and various shops and restaurants within the immediate vicinity. Alessandro and Valentina were fantastic hosts - nothing was too much trouble. Our taxi mistakenly dropped us around the corner and we were soon rescued. Alessandro also gave us several recommendations for eating places. They arranged our airport transfer for us and very helpfully allowed us to store our luggage with them during our last day. A beautiful apartment situated in a very pleasant area of Rome - we hope to return!

Reviews.Title: “The end to a Perfect Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Boadicia
Reviews.Content: A week on an Olive Grove and a week on a Lemon Grove on the Amalfi and to finish it all three nights at the Purple Home in Rome and so close to the Vatican, St Peters, the Pantheon, the main piazzas, Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps! The flat was beautiful and had everything that we could have wanted. It was lovely to explore Roma by day and come back to the flat to relax and chill then change and walk in to Roma and experience the night atmosphere. The flat sits in a lovely area with a one of the nicest restaurants a few 100 metres away and walking in to the heart of Vatican City couldn't have been easier. It was spotlessly clean and the lifts and walkways were cleaned daily.It is equiped with everything that you could possible need. The neighbours were very friendly too! Walks along the River at night were memorable and it gave us a taste of what it would be like to live in Roma rather than be a tourist and stay in an Hotel. There is a superb supermarket very close by and we were able to buy local cheeses, meats and breads for breakfast before setting off on our days out! We loved the decor in the flat and the Purple theme and we felt at home and very comfortable there. As a city base it couldn't be better and from the balcony one could see the windows of the vatican. Thia flat is to be recommended for a family who want to experience Roma from a leisurely start each day;to come and go as they please and not be tied to meal times and formality! My daughter Rachel planned the holiday and Roma was the icing on the cake for me. Ruth

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location combined with warm hospitality”
Reviews.Author: V-Farm
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome at New Year's, an excellent time a year to see this great city. The visit could not have started in a better way. The landlord picked us up at the train station, and brought us to the apartment. He thoroughly explained to us all the things relevant to know, and gave us some valuable hints and tricks, both for the immediate surroundings and the city itself. The apartment's location was perfect for our preferences. Quiet surroundings, yet in walking distance of most of the interesting sights, inparticularly Vatican City and St.Peter's Basilica. Upon arrival, the apartment was cleaned to perfection, and cleaning at check-out was also included in the price. The warmth and hospitality of the host was indisputable, which demonstrated a genuine desire to ensure we had a pleasant experience for the entire duration of our stay. The apartment and host have both deserved the highest of recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Clean apartment!!!”
Reviews.Author: Natalia_1_11
Reviews.Content: Nice area with restaurants and cafés. Close to food store.Everything you need is in the small kitchen.The rooms was very clean and nice furnised .Lovely apartment. Very comfortable.Alessandro very nice and helpful. Recommended!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and a great price!!!”
Reviews.Author: femelfy
Reviews.Content: Valentina was amazing. This trip was to celebrate my Grandma's 80th birthday by exploring Rome, doing Palm sunday at the Vatican, and traveling to Pescara to see where our family came from. Valentina worked out a great deal with me for 8 days and was more than accommodating. The location is within a few blocks from the Vatican, main bus lines and the train station. A block away is a grocery store, bar, restaurant and walk a few more blocks and lots of cafes, restaurants, gift shops, almost anything you could want. If you have a car or decide to rent one, DO NOT park up by the main grocery store. The guy is an A#@! The sign says 20 euros all day and he took advantage of us, telling us that since we didn't have cash it would be 40 euros for the night. When we came back ten minutes later with cash, he raised the price to 70 euros and pretended to not understand us. We took the car out which he charged us 10 euros for the 10 minutes. After pulling it out of the garage we discovered parking it on the street was a better deal and less of a chance of being ripped off. Overall rating 100% satisfaction for the flat; 90% satisfaction for the area (minus for parking).

Reviews.Title: “Purple Home was an ideal Roman appartement”
Reviews.Author: T0nn
Reviews.Content: The Purple Home was roomy and quaint, and it really had 3 balconies. The master bedroom was great, another smaller room we didn't even use and there was also a walk-in wardrobe. A short stroll down the street from the Purple Home and your standing in St Peter's Square, and not so far from the real centre of the City. The 64 bus (St Piedro - Central Termini) takes you there even quicker and it stops outside on the street (min. 4 buses/uur).. The local supermarket is close by and pretty reasonably priced, with heaps of fresh products too. The staff were helpful and friendly, and their website was also full of information on what to do and where to eat in Rome but the wireless didn't work optimally. The 6 day stay in Rome at the Purple Home was value for money and a real treat at that. We would definitely stay another week Rome in the Purple Home..

HotelInfo.Name: Purple Home
HotelInfo.Address: Rampa delle Mura Aurelie, 9, 00165 Rome, Italy
